DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: This command displays the dynamic authorization server parameters.
DOCGEN.USAGE: This command displays the dynamic authorization server parameters.

PARAM.name: client
PARAM.help: Display dynamic authorization statistics for DAC.

PARAM.name: client-type-subcmds
PARAM.help: Sets the accepted authorization types for dynamic RADIUS clients.

PARAM.name: all
PARAM.help: Selects all COA client authentication types. All authentication attributes must match for the authentication to succeed.

PARAM.name: ipaddr_hostname
PARAM.help: Enter a valid IP address or hostname of a DAC.

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: This command displays the DAS global and per client counters.
DOCGEN.USAGE: This command displays the DAS global and per client counters.
DOCGEN.EXAMPLE:
sonic-cli# show radius-server dynamic-author statistics
Number of CoA Requests Received....................... 79 Number of CoA ACK Responses Sent...................... 17 Number of CoA NAK Responses Sent...................... 77 Number of CoA Requests Ignored........................ 78 Number of CoA Missing/Unsupported Attribute Requests.. 23 Number of CoA Session Context Not Found Requests...... 89 Number of CoA Invalid Attribute Value Requests........ 13 Number of Administratively Prohibited Requests........ 12 sonic-cli#
sonic-cli# show radius-server dynamic-author statistics client all
DAC Address........................................... 1.1.1.1 Number of CoA Requests Received....................... 77 Number of CoA ACK Responses Sent...................... 88 Number of CoA NAK Responses Sent...................... 66 Number of CoA Requests Ignored........................ 7 Number of CoA Missing/Unsupported Attribute Requests.. 3 Number of CoA Session Context Not Found Requests...... 4 Number of CoA Invalid Attribute Value Requests........ 2 Number of Administratively Prohibited Requests........ 8
DAC Address........................................... test Number of CoA Requests Received....................... 90 Number of CoA ACK Responses Sent...................... 32 Number of CoA NAK Responses Sent...................... 36 Number of CoA Requests Ignored........................ 79 Number of CoA Missing/Unsupported Attribute Requests.. 50 Number of CoA Session Context Not Found Requests...... 28 Number of CoA Invalid Attribute Value Requests........ 39 Number of Administratively Prohibited Requests........ 45 sonic-cli#

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: This command displays the all DAS running config.
DOCGEN.USAGE: This command displays the all DAS running config.
DOCGEN.EXAMPLE:
sonic# configure terminal sonic(config)# authentication command bounce-port disable-port sonic(config)# authentication command bounce-port ignore sonic(config)# authentication command disable-port ignore sonic(config)# aaa server radius dynamic-author sonic(config-radius-da)# auth-type Sets the accepted authorization types for dynamic RADIUS clients. client Configure DAC. end Exit to EXEC mode exit Exit from current mode ignore Sets the switch to ignore certain authentication parameters from dynamic RADIUS clients. no Unconfigure dynamic authorization. port Sets the port on which to listen for requests from authorized dynamic RADIUS clients. request-timeout Sets the timeout interval for the DAS request packets. server-key Sets the shared secret to verify client COA requests for this server. vrf Sets the vrf on which to send the response to the authorized dynamic RADIUS clients.
sonic(config-radius-da)# auth-type any sonic(config-radius-da)# client 1.1.1.1 server-key test sonic(config-radius-da)# ignore server-key sonic(config-radius-da)# ignore session-key sonic(config-radius-da)# port 1212 sonic(config-radius-da)# server-key 2.2.2.2 sonic(config-radius-da)# request-timeout 10 sonic(config-radius-da)# vrf mgmt
sonic(config-radius-da)# do show running-configuration das authentication command bounce-port ignore authentication command disable-port ignore ! aaa server radius dynamic-author auth-type any port 1212 client 1.1.1.1 server-key U2FsdGVkX1+sVv1uXlOvwG7/17QGWv3GMQfDPizZ6O0= encrypted ignore session-key ignore server-key request-timeout 10 server-key U2FsdGVkX19jHWn93adhy6NAG/DzAPYpuhn0UV14Kfw= encrypted vrf mgmt sonic(config-radius-da)#

PARAM.name: client
PARAM.help: Clear dynamic authorization statistics for DAC.

PARAM.name: client-type-subcmds
PARAM.help: Select the dynamic RADIUS clients type.

PARAM.name: all
PARAM.help: To Clear all client statistics.

PARAM.name: ipaddr_hostname
PARAM.help: Enter a valid IP address or hostname of a DAC.

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: This command clears radius dynamic authorization global counters and per DAS client counters.
DOCGEN.USAGE: This command clears radius dynamic authorization global counters and per DAS client counters.
DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic-cli# clear radius-server dynamic-author statistics [ client { all | ipv4 | ipv6 | hostname }]

COMMAND.name: authentication command
COMMAND.help: Sets the switch to act accordingly for the requests from dynamic authorization clients.

COMMAND.name: authentication command bounce-port
COMMAND.help: Sets the switch to ignore bounce-port requests from dynamic authorization clients.

COMMAND.name: authentication command bounce-port ignore
COMMAND.help: Sets the switch to ignore bounce-port requests from dynamic authorization clients.

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: This command configures the device to ignore a RADIUS server bounce-host-port command. The bounce-host-port command causes a host to flap the link on an authentication port. The link flap causes DHCP renegotiation from one or more hosts connected to this port.
DOCGEN.USAGE: This command configures the device to ignore a RADIUS server bounce-host-port command.
DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic-cli(config)# authentication command bounce-port ignore

COMMAND.name: no authentication command
COMMAND.help: Sets the switch to act accordingly for the requests from dynamic authorization clients.

COMMAND.name: no authentication command bounce-port
COMMAND.help: Sets the switch to ignore bounce-port requests from dynamic authorization clients.

COMMAND.name: no authentication command bounce-port ignore
COMMAND.help: Sets the switch to ignore bounce-port requests from dynamic authorization clients.

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: This command configures the device to ignore a RADIUS server bounce-host-port command. The bounce-host-port command causes a host to flap the link on an authentication port. The link flap causes DHCP renegotiation from one or more hosts connected to this port.
DOCGEN.USAGE: This command configures the device to ignore a RADIUS server bounce-host-port command.
DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic-cli(config)# no authentication command bounce-port ignore

COMMAND.name: authentication command disable-port
COMMAND.help: Sets the switch to ignore disable-port requests from dynamic authorization clients.

COMMAND.name: authentication command disable-port ignore
COMMAND.help: Sets the switch to ignore requests from dynamic authorization clients.

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: This command configures the device to ignore a RADIUS server disable-host-port command. The disable-host-port command puts the host port to D-Disabled state with reason as "coa disabled". The D-Disabled port with reason as ?coa disabled? can be re-enabled either if the auto recovery cause is enabled for coa after the expiry of the auto recovery timer or manually by the administrator by not shutting down the port.
DOCGEN.USAGE: This command configures the device to ignore a RADIUS server disable-host-port command.
DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic-cli(config)# authentication command disable-port ignore

COMMAND.name: no authentication command disable-port
COMMAND.help: Sets the switch to ignore disable-port requests from dynamic authorization clients.

COMMAND.name: no authentication command disable-port ignore
COMMAND.help: Sets the switch to ignore requests from dynamic authorization clients.

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: This command configures the device to ignore a RADIUS server disable-host-port command. The disable-host-port command puts the host port to D-Disabled state with reason as "coa disabled". The D-Disabled port with reason as ?coa disabled? can be re-enabled either if the auto recovery cause is enabled for coa after the expiry of the auto recovery timer or manually by the administrator by not shutting down the port.
DOCGEN.USAGE: This command configures the device to ignore a RADIUS server disable-host-port command.
DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic-cli(config)# no authentication command disable-port ignore

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: This command enables DAS functionality and enters dynamic authorization local server configuration mode.
DOCGEN.USAGE: This command enables DAS functionality and enters dynamic authorization local server configuration mode.
DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic-cli# configure terminal sonic-cli(config)# aaa server radius dynamic-author sonic-cli(config-radius-da)#

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: This command diables DAS functionality on the switch.
DOCGEN.USAGE: This command diables DAS functionality on the switch.
DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic-cli# configure terminal sonic-cli(config)# no aaa server radius dynamic-author

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Displays current DAS configuration
DOCGEN.USAGE: Use this command to DAS display running configurations.
DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic-cli(config)# aaa server radius dynamic-author sonic-cli(config-radius-da)# show configuration ! aaa server radius dynamic-author auth-type session-key port 8989 client 7.7.7.7 server-key M2FsdGVkX17LcQREyGJP/aDuWTi34jJLzdqNy9W5WxI= encrypted ignore server-key server-key U2FsdGVkX18LcQREyGJP/aDuWTi34jJLzdqNy9W5WxI= encrypted request-timeout 10 vrf mgmt sonic-cli(config-radius-da)#

COMMAND.name: auth-type
COMMAND.help: Sets the accepted authorization types for dynamic RADIUS clients.

PARAM.name: auth-type-subcmds
PARAM.help: Sets the accepted authorization types for dynamic RADIUS clients.

PARAM.name: all
PARAM.help: Selects all COA client authentication types. All authentication attributes must match for the authentication to succeed.

PARAM.name: any
PARAM.help: Selects any COA client authentication type. Any authentication attribute may match for the authentication to succeed.

PARAM.name: session-key
PARAM.help: Indicates that the session-key must match for authentication to succeed.

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: This command specifies the type of authorization that the device must use for RADIUS clients. The client must match the configured attributes for authorization.
DOCGEN.USAGE: This command configures the accepted authorization types for dynamic RADIUS clients.
DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic-cli(config)# aaa server radius dynamic-author sonic-cli(config-radius-da)# auth-type session-key

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: This command resets switch identifier to its default value. The default value is last 16-bits from the system mac address.
DOCGEN.USAGE: This command resets switch identifier to its default value. The default value is last 16-bits from the system mac address.
DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic-cli(config)# aaa server radius dynamic-author sonic-cli(config-radius-da)# no auth-type

COMMAND.name: port
COMMAND.help: Sets the port on which to listen for requests from authorized dynamic RADIUS clients.

PARAM.name: portNumber
PARAM.help: An integer in the range 1025-65535.

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: This command specifies the UDP port on which a device listens for RADIUS requests from configured RADIUS clients.
DOCGEN.USAGE: This command configures the UDP port on which a device listens for RADIUS requests from configured RADIUS clients. The supported range for the port-number is 1025 to 65535.
DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic-cli(config)# aaa server radius dynamic-author sonic-cli(config-radius-da)# port 8989

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: This command resets enterprise identifier to its default value. The default value is last 16-bits from the system mac address
DOCGEN.USAGE: This command resets enterprise identifier to its default value. The default value is last 16-bits from the system mac address
DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic-cli(config)# aaa server radius dynamic-author sonic-cli(config-radius-da)# no port

PARAM.name: hostname_or_ipaddr
PARAM.help: Enter a valid IP address or hostname of a DAC.

PARAM.name: server-key
PARAM.help: Sets the shared secret to verify client COA requests for this server.

PARAM.name: key
PARAM.help: shared secret (ASCII printable except SPACE, #, and COMMA, Max Len: 65)

PARAM.name: encrypted
PARAM.help: Key is in encrypted format

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: This command configures the IP address or IPV6 address or hostname of the AAA server client. It uses the optional **server-key** keyword at the client level.
DOCGEN.USAGE: This command configures the IP address or IPV6 address or hostname of the AAA server client. It uses the optional **server-key** keyword at the client level.
DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic-cli(config)# aaa server radius dynamic-author sonic-cli(config-radius-da)# client 1.1.1.1 server-key U2FsdGVkX18LcQREyGJP/aDuWTi34jJLzdqNy9W5WxI= encryted sonic-cli(config-radius-da)#

PARAM.name: hostname_or_ipaddr
PARAM.help: Enter a valid IP address or hostname of a DAC.

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: This command removes the IP address or IPV6 address or hostname of the AAA server client.
DOCGEN.USAGE: This command removes the IP address or IPV6 address or hostname of the AAA server client.
DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic-cli(config)# aaa server radius dynamic-author sonic-cli(config-radius-da)# no client 1.1.1.1 sonic-cli(config-radius-da)#

COMMAND.name: ignore
COMMAND.help: Sets the switch to ignore certain authentication parameters from dynamic RADIUS clients.

COMMAND.name: ignore session-key
COMMAND.help: Do not attempt to authenticate with the session key.

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: This command configures the device to ignore the session key.
DOCGEN.USAGE: This command configures the device to ignore the session key. This command execution fails when the auth-type set to "session-key" as the authentication can happen only based on the session-key attribute.
DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic-cli(config)# aaa server radius dynamic-author sonic-cli(config-radius-da)# ignore session-key sonic-cli(config-radius-da)#

COMMAND.name: no ignore
COMMAND.help: Removes the config which makes switch to ignore certain authentication parameters from dynamic RADIUS clients.

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: This command removes ignore session-key configuration.
DOCGEN.USAGE: This command removes ignore session-key configuration.
DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic-cli(config)# aaa server radius dynamic-author sonic-cli(config-radius-da)# no ignore session-key sonic-cli(config-radius-da)#

COMMAND.name: ignore server-key
COMMAND.help: Do not attmept to authenticate with the server key.

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: This command configures the device to ignore the server key.
DOCGEN.USAGE: This command configures the device to ignore the server key.
DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic-cli(config)# aaa server radius dynamic-author sonic-cli(config-radius-da)# ignore server-key sonic-cli(config-radius-da)#

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: This command removes ignore server-key configuration.
DOCGEN.USAGE: This command removes ignore server-key configuration.
DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic-cli(config)# aaa server radius dynamic-author sonic-cli(config-radius-da)# no ignore server-key sonic-cli(config-radius-da)#

COMMAND.name: server-key
COMMAND.help: Sets the shared secret to verify client COA requests for this server.

PARAM.name: key
PARAM.help: shared secret (ASCII printable except SPACE, #, and COMMA, Max Len: 65)

PARAM.name: encrypted
PARAM.help: Key is in encrypted format

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: This command configures a global shared secret that is used for all dynamic authorization clients that do not have an individual shared secret key configured.
DOCGEN.USAGE: This command configures a global shared secret that is used for all dynamic authorization clients that do not have an individual shared secret key configured.
DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic-cli(config)# aaa server radius dynamic-author sonic-cli(config-radius-da)# server-key U2FsdGVkX18LcQREyGJP/aDuWTi34jJLzdqNy9W5WxI= encryted sonic-cli(config-radius-da)#

COMMAND.name: no server-key
COMMAND.help: Removes the shared secret which used to verify client COA requests for this server.

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: This command removes the shared secret which used to verify client COA requests for this server.
DOCGEN.USAGE: This command removes the shared secret which used to verify client COA requests for this server.
DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic-cli(config)# aaa server radius dynamic-author sonic-cli(config-radius-da)# no server-key sonic-cli(config-radius-da)#

COMMAND.name: vrf
COMMAND.help: Sets the vrf on which to send the response to the authorized dynamic RADIUS clients.

PARAM.name: mgmt
PARAM.help: Management VRF

PARAM.name: vrf-name
PARAM.help: Name of VRF

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: This command specifies the vrf on which to send the response to the authorized dynamic RADIUS clients.
DOCGEN.USAGE: This command specifies the vrf on which to send the response to the authorized dynamic RADIUS clients. vrf specified here used be pre-created in the switch.
DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic-cli(config)# aaa server radius dynamic-author sonic-cli(config-radius-da)# vrf mgmt

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: This command deletes the vrf configured for DAS.
DOCGEN.USAGE: This command deletes the vrf configured for DAS.
DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic-cli(config)# aaa server radius dynamic-author sonic-cli(config-radius-da)# no vrf

COMMAND.name: request-timeout
COMMAND.help: Sets the timeout interval for the DAS request packets.

PARAM.name: timeoutInterval
PARAM.help: An integer in the range 1-30.

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: This command specifies the time interval after which the request received by the DAS from the DAC will be timed out if there is no response received to the DAS by the registered applications before that interval.
DOCGEN.USAGE: This command configures the time interval after which the request received by the DAS from the DAC will be timed out if there is no response received to the DAS by the registered applications before that interval. The supported range for the request-timeout is 1 to 30.
DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic-cli(config)# aaa server radius dynamic-author sonic-cli(config-radius-da)# request-timeout 5

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: This command resets the time interval after which the request received by the DAS from the DAC will be timed out to the default value. The default value is 3 seconds.
DOCGEN.USAGE: This command resets the time interval after which the request received by the DAS from the DAC will be timed out to the default value. The default value is 3 seconds.
DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic-cli(config)# aaa server radius dynamic-author sonic-cli(config-radius-da)# no request-timeout
